meanings.definition: The quality of being easily bent or flexed.
meanings.sent1: The pliantness of the rubber band allowed it to stretch without breaking.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the pliantness of the yoga mat during my exercises.
meanings.sent3: The pliantness of the spaghetti made it challenging to twirl around the fork.
meanings.sent4: Her mind showed a pliantness that mirrored the flexibility of a gymnast.
meanings.sent5: The pliantness of the tree branches in the wind was a mesmerizing sight.

meanings.definition: The ability to be easily influenced or persuaded.
meanings.sent1: His pliantness in accepting new ideas made him a valuable team member.
meanings.sent2: She used her pliantness to convince others to join the charity event.
meanings.sent3: The pliantness of his opinions often led to changing his mind quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her pliantness in negotiations was both a strength and a weakness.
meanings.sent5: The pliantness of the clay made it easy to mold into different shapes.

meanings.definition: The state of being adaptable or versatile.
meanings.sent1: The pliantness of the fabric allowed for easy alterations to the dress.
meanings.sent2: His pliantness in different situations made him a successful entrepreneur.
meanings.sent3: The pliantness of the schedule allowed for last-minute changes without stress.
meanings.sent4: Her pliantness in learning new languages impressed her classmates.
meanings.sent5: The pliantness of the material made it suitable for various crafting projects.
